title: Are there any good universities for an MS in the US which do not require a statement of purpose or a letter of recommendation? - Quora
tags: The College and University Master's Program Experience
Master's Programs in the United States of America
Colleges and Universities in the United States of America

response.answer_text: Letters of recommendation and a Statement of Purpose are not mandatory for the electrical engineering masters' program at USC. The electrical engineering masters' program at ASU does not require letters of recommendation either but needs a Statement of Purpose. I think there are a couple of others as well. I will edit the answer if I find them.

No, almost all US universities require statement of intent & recommendations from atleast 1 person. However, if you've done undergraduate education in the same university, they may waive this requirement. Also, if you decide to do a 4+1 integrated Master's program, its not required.
